peojectName: Design of self-driving vehicles for warehouse storage
description:
Used Keil C to develop an MCU (8051) for connecting the monitor and micro controller unit, responsible for writing code for the Infrared sensor and calculating the mechanical cycle.
This project used the waterfall model.

peojectName: Research on Elevator with Brushless Motor and Regenerative Braking
description:
Used Keil C to write the code connecting the main motor driver and MCU (tm4c123gxl), especially for the Wifi module (ESP8266).
Produced the motor driver, including printed circuit board, soldering, and conducted board testing.
Drafted the paper and published at the graduation project seminar.
The project was awarded first place in the Electromagnetic Energy category.
This project used the waterfall model.

company: Huaya Ya Dong Ying Plastics Corporation, Shandong, China
description:
Learned the Enterprise Resource planning (ERP) system for management.
Used ERP system for purchasing decision-making and storage stock monitoring.

peojectName: Brain Computer Interface System for Human and Machine Synchronisation
description:
Used raspberry pi as a demo server for the project, which allowed other devices to access the server via local internet.
Used python to simulate the brain signal.
Created a stable and workable environment to host the project.

company: Sydney Comber Street Studios with hunLAB
description:
Used 8th wall to develop the AR project, using A-Frame, three.js and 8th wall library.
Used Unity to develop a VR interactive experience titled ‘Brilliant Earth,’ which were experienced by hundreds of audience members via Meta Quest 2 headset.
Collaborated with over 15 visual artists and designers.
Developed the interactive exhibition guide website.
Used Github to manage iterations of the immersive project.

Used php and basic html, css, js.
Created a database based on postgreDB using Elastic Beanstalk.
Monitored website usage using AWS.
Used Github for iteration management.

Utilized FileZilla for updating the website's footer, which was developed using PHP and MySQL.
The website is developed by the wordpress

Used Html(react), css, js for developing the website, including the phone version and computerversion.
Using github to control the source code
